DRAG DROP
-

You are setting up the product catalog in Dynamics 365 Sales.

The following promotions must be set up in the product catalog:

• Customers receive a free mug with the purchase of one can of soda.
• Customers receive a five percent price decrease on the purchase of 12 cases of soda.
• Soda has various prices based on whether the purchase is for one can, one six-pack, or a case.

You need to choose which feature to set up in the product catalog.

Which feature should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate features to the correct requirements. Each feature may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

//IMG//

A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales. The company does not use any custom views or forms.

You select a customer and create an appointment for the next day.

You need to find the appointment.

Which two places will display the appointment? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

questions.question_text:
You are creating a forecast.

You want to include only opportunities that sell more than 100 units.

You need to configure this within the system.

What should you configure?

A sales manager creates a marketing list that includes all contacts from a specific city. The manager plans to use the list in a campaign.

The manager forgot to filter out contacts who have a credit hold.

You need to create a campaign with the updated contacts.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In My opinion it has to be B 
it makes no sense to add both marketing lists

Selected Answer: A
Option B. Remove the contacts from the marketing list by using Advanced Find is not the correct answer because it would modify the original marketing list. If you remove contacts directly from the original marketing list, you lose the ability to track which contacts were originally included before the credit hold filter was applied. This could be problematic if you want to analyze the original list in the future.

On the other hand, option A. Copy the original marketing list to static and remove the contacts by using Advanced Find allows you to preserve the original marketing list while creating a new, updated list that excludes contacts with a credit hold. This way, you can track both the original and updated lists, which can be useful for comparison and analysis.
I think it should be A as it has asked to just filter out the contact not to exclude from marketing list

Selected Answer: B
I think B should be the correct answer as it makes no sense to include the incorrect list in the campaign.

choices.A: Copy the original marketing list to static and remove the contacts by using Advanced Find. Add both marketing lists to the campaign.
choices.D: Remove the contacts from the marketing list by using a Lookup. Then add the marketing list to the campaign.
choices.B: Remove the contacts from the marketing list by using Advanced Find. Then add the marketing list to the campaign.
choices.C: Create a new dynamic marketing list by using different purpose and source fields. Then add both marketing lists to the campaign.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A customer plans to track external individuals who influence an opportunity.

The sales manager wants to add a new role named influencer to identify these individuals.

You need to create the role.

How should you configure the system? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Role Type: Connection role;
Role Category: Stakeholder (influencer is a stakeholder).
